original_solution_mapping.L1: The fair made $2520 from tickets, so they had 2520 / 5 = <<2520/5=504>>504 people attend the fair.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Two-thirds of those people will buy food, so 504 * 2 / 3 = <<504*2/3=336>>336 people will buy food.
original_solution_mapping.L3: The fair will make 336 * 8 = $<<336*8=2688>>2688 from food.
original_solution_mapping.L4: A quarter of the people will go on a ride, so 504 / 4 = <<504/4=126>>126 people will go on a ride.
original_solution_mapping.L5: The fair will make 126 * 4 = $<<126*4=504>>504 from rides.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2684.
    Returns: the total dollars the fair made.
    """
    # L1
    total_ticket_revenue = 2520 # The fair made $2520 from tickets
    ticket_price = 5 # charges $5 for a ticket
    total_attendees = total_ticket_revenue / ticket_price

    # L2
    food_numerator = 2 # Two-thirds of the people
    food_denominator = 3 # Two-thirds of the people
    people_buying_food = total_attendees * food_numerator / food_denominator

    # L3
    food_price = 8 # deep-fried fair food for $8
    revenue_from_food = people_buying_food * food_price

    # L4
    ride_denominator = 4 # one quarter will go on a ride
    people_going_on_ride = total_attendees / ride_denominator

    # L5
    ride_price = 4 # a ride for $4
    revenue_from_rides = people_going_on_ride * ride_price

    # L6
    souvenir_denominator = 8 # one eighth will spend $15 on a souvenir
    people_buying_souvenir = total_attendees / souvenir_denominator

    # L7
    souvenir_price = 15 # $15 on a souvenir
    revenue_from_souvenirs = people_buying_souvenir * souvenir_price

    # L8
    total_revenue = total_ticket_revenue + revenue_from_food + revenue_from_rides + revenue_from_souvenirs

    # FA
    answer = total_revenue
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The fair made ${total_ticket_revenue} from tickets, so they had {total_ticket_revenue} / {ticket_price} = <<{total_ticket_revenue}/{ticket_price}={total_attendees}>>{total_attendees} people attend the fair.

Two-thirds of those people will buy food, so {total_attendees} * {food_numerator} / {food_denominator} = <<{total_attendees}*{food_numerator}/{food_denominator}={people_buying_food}>>{people_buying_food} people will buy food.
The fair will make {people_buying_food} * {food_price} = $<<{people_buying_food}*{food_price}={revenue_from_food}>>{revenue_from_food} from food.
A quarter of the people will go on a ride, so {total_attendees} / {ride_denominator} = <<{total_attendees}/{ride_denominator}={people_going_on_ride}>>{people_going_on_ride} people will go on a ride.
The fair will make {people_going_on_ride} * {ride_price} = $<<{people_going_on_ride}*{ride_price}={revenue_from_rides}>>{revenue_from_rides} from rides.

An eighth of the people will buy a souvenir, so {total_attendees} / {souvenir_denominator} = <<{total_attendees}/{souvenir_denominator}={people_buying_souvenir}>>{people_buying_souvenir} people will buy souvenirs.
The fair will make {people_buying_souvenir} * {souvenir_price} = $<<{people_buying_souvenir}*{souvenir_price}={revenue_from_souvenirs}>>{revenue_from_souvenirs} from souvenirs.

In all, the fair will make {total_ticket_revenue} + {revenue_from_food} + {revenue_from_rides} + {revenue_from_souvenirs} = $<<{total_ticket_revenue}+{revenue_from_food}+{revenue_from_rides}+{revenue_from_souvenirs}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue}.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'ticket_price' (5) was used instead of 'food_numerator' (2).
